item.title: Moparisthebest Story
item.dc:creator: @0uch_a_arr0w 0uch a arr0w
item.description:
@0uch_a_arr0w wrote:

An essay on Moparisthebest

In this essay I will consider the social, economic and political factors of Moparisthebest. Underestimate Moparisthebest at your peril. Cited by many as the single most important influence on post modern micro eco compartmentalism, there are just not enough blues songs written about Moparisthebest. Inevitably feelings run deep amongst the upper echelons of progressive service sector organisations, who form the last great hope for our civilzation. In the light of this I will break down the issues in order to give each of them the thought that they fully deserve

Social Factors

Interweaving social trends form a strong net in which we are all trapped. The immortal and indispensable phrase �honesty is the best policy� [1] failed to understand that if one seriously intends to ‘not judge a book by its cover’, then one must read a lot of books. No symbol is more potent than Moparisthebest in society today. It helps to provide some sort of equilibrium in this world of ever changing, always yearning chaos.

Primarily Moparisthebest builds trust among the people. Clearly it promotes higher individualism and obeyence of instinct. As soon as a child meets Moparisthebest they are changed.

Economic Factors

Do we critique the markets, or do they in-fact critique us? We will study the Inter-Spam model using the median instead of the mean, where possible.
Annual
Military
Budget

	Moparisthebest

It is apparent from the graph that the influence of Moparisthebest is strong. What is the secret to its strength? In spite of the best efforts of The World Bank the annual military budget world wide are driven entirely by Moparisthebest. The financial press seems unable to make up its mind on these issues which unsettles investors.

Political Factors

Politics has in some areas been seen to embrace an increasing ananiathesis of intergovernmentalism leading to neo-functionalism. Placing theory on the scales of justice and weighing it against practice can produce similar results to contrasting Moparisthebest and ones own image of themselves.

Consider this, spoken at the tender age of 14 by one of the great political analysts Demetrius Tuigamala ‘I don’t believe in ghosts, but I do believe in democracy.’ [2] What a fantastic quote. I feel strongly that if politicians spent less time thinking about Moparisthebest and put more effort into their family life, that we would have a very different country.
Is Moparisthebest politically correct, in every sense? Each man, woman and to a lesser extent, child, must make up their own mind.

Conclusion

To reiterate, Moparisthebest is, to use the language of the streets ‘Super Cool.’ It enriches, brings glamour to an unglamorous time and never hides.

As a parting shot here are the words of super-star Beyonce Kournikova: ‘It’s been nice educating you.’ [3]

[1] Traditional - possibly first said by King Arthor… but probably not.

[2] Tuigamala - Captain Sir - 1844 Inevitable Publishing

[3] Everything you always wanted to know about Moparisthebest, but were afraid to ask. - Issue 287 - QKS Publishing

Read full topic

Once there was a guy name moparisthebest on runescape he played for a month and got to lvl 100 but then jagex banned him for no reason. moparisthebest then started to cheat and emailed jagex saying he hated forgien cars. he then met katienks who apparently was into rs cheating too. together they made a website called…katienks.com,but apparently katienks had a kid and sold the site or something. mopar then created moparisthebest.com the best cheating community in the world.

item.title: Moparisthebest Story
item.dc:creator: @Dell451 Dell451
item.description:
@Dell451 wrote:

Here, try this one

The year was 2003 A.D. and a kid named __________(Mopar) was playing online, when he stumbled across a Java based game, Run Escape, so he started playing…
After a month or two, the kid was hooked, and he was always trying to be better than everyone else, but he never had the time, becuase this kid was an exteremly intelligent and althletic youth, so he had actives like Baseball and Ja Parody to do, so the smart young handsome lad reserched online and found out about .Java and he relized it was his Destiny to create a website to help other extremely intelligent young people who didn’t have the time becuase they were playing outside or busy with their friends. So he created the website and he thought of the coolest name ever, Moparisthebest.

The End
My best post ever!

item.title: Moparisthebest Story
item.dc:creator: @wyn10 wyn10
item.description:
@wyn10 wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath_96, post:10, topic:34435”]Once upon a time, in a land far, far, away, a champion named moparisthebest came to fight the evils of Evil, Incorporated through their subsidiary, Jagex Ltd. Mopar came in his 1969 muscle car, the Dodge Charger. He drove through the front door of Jagex, Ltd with his mighty hood ornament, simultaneously programming robots to fight the evils of Jagex through their own game. moparisthebest advanced deeper into the realm of Jagex, and met with a level 1 gopher. He cast the mighty ‘Exhaust Fumes’ spell, and the level 1 gopher was defeated. Mopar picked up the drop, a key card which the gopher happened to be carrying for Andrew. Mopar pocketed the key card, and headed towards Andrew’s office.

Meanwhile, in a parallel universe…

Mopar’s bots ravaged through xegaJ headquarters and were met with werdnA’s final defense: 2048 bit RSA encryption. The bots began to brute force the RSA key, but to no avail! werdnA would die of natural causes by the time the key was reached. The Bot Scouts were called in, and explored xegaJ headquarters for the key. They did not find the key, but however, they ran into a level 126 Disgruntled Employee. The Disgruntled Employee teamed up with the Bot Scouts and returned to meet with the other bots. The bots advanced and reached werdnA’s evil throne. However, werdnA could not be defeated as long as his counterpart in the parallel universe, Andrew, remained in power. The bots returned to mopar’s universe and delivered the key. Through deus ex machina, the key happened to be the same in both universes.

Mopar entered Andrew’s chamber and discovered him dead, on his throne. The Jagex cat, Bob, sat on the throne in his place. Mopar threw his wrench at Bob, and Bob exploded, turning into a portal to the other universe. Mopar and his army advanced into the parallel universe and defeated werdnA, with a magic incantation:

new Thread(werdnA).stop();

All references to werdnA were thus deleted from the pages of history, and he was thrown to the Black Hole by the garbage collector. Mopar duplicated his disk of returning and followed him there. He created a prison, and threw werdnA in the same cell as ‘Bubba.’ Thus, he compensated for the years of torture and despotism werdnA inflicted on the players of RuneScape. Mopar reprogrammed the universe, through another incantation:

universe.setRuler("moparisthebest");

And that, my friends, is the story of how the universe turned into a garage.

100% by Aftermath.
Enjoy.[/quote]

10/10 awsome and funny

Read full topic
